website_summaries.verdict: Owners say the pain relief from the socks comes quickly. Socks fit easily under shoes or other socks.
pros: Right mix of support and comfort to help with plantar fasciitis and other foot pain immediately
Owners say these socks hold their shape and support after several weeks of wear
cons: A few customers reported the seams gave way on the socks after a few washings

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have tendonitis in both feet and herniated disc/pinched nerve radiating to big toes. I have spent the past 2 months buying and returning socks that were uncomfortable and did nothing but compress too much. I just received these today and they are amazing. They stay in place and feel wonderful! I would suggest ordering large as there is no way I could use a small and I wear a size 8 (female) shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have flat foot and I’ve tried the different shoe size insert and still everyday when I get home from my ankles looks like I’m pregnant with quadruplets that’s how big they get I’m a manager in retail that means I’m on my feet constantly and I work over 10 hours a day. This week I’m doing inventory at my job I start at 5a and don’t leave until 630p and when I got home take them off I was expecting to see my ankles the same way but they were not. Don’t get me wrong they were big but not that big I was very pleasently surprised and plan on buying more today.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this itty bitty looking sleeve is making a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this itty bitty looking sleeve is making a world of a difference! I've been hobbling around with a bum heel for about 4 months now. Got the sleeve on Friday and have been wearing it all weekend. I walked all over a mall today and my foot still doesn't hurt! Usually by that evening I'm in severe pain and can't deal. This is a magic sock!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Scherzinger

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful that these would be effective, based on many positive reviews. They're doesn't seem to be much compression around the arch, but there's plenty (too much) at the ankle! After a short period of wearing, blood flow to the foot is restricted, which isn't an optimal situation. There's a card enclosed with these socks that you contact the company before you leave a negative review. I did so, over 24 hours ago, and have heard nothing. So, these are being returned.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Help
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product hoping it would help my feet conditions. I went to the Podiatrist and found out that my plantar fascia and Achilles’ tendon are inflamed in both feet . So I bought this and wore this product today for the first time , and got absolutely no relief for my plantar fascia at all . The pain underneath my heels was killing me all day long at work . So , I am not so happy with this product at all .
customer_reviews.author: Krittika

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this. I bought 2 pairs (one for me ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this. I bought 2 pairs (one for me and one for my husband) It's too tight and it cuts off the circulation in my foot. When I try to return it, they were charging me for shipping so I decided to just keep it because it's not worth for my to pay for the shipping. This item is laying around in my closet not being use. I feel I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Detlefsen

customer_reviews.title: couldn't fit over my toes
customer_reviews.text: These were so small and tight I couldn't fit them over my toes. They state they go to size 11, I'm a 10 and no luck. I can't find a return button for them. How can I return these? I bought 2 pairs due to all the feedback being pretty good. If they had a larger size, I might try it, but these l/xl definitely DON'T fit a women's size 10. If there is good customer sertvice and I can return these, I will raise my rating and let you know it's OK to take the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Who are these supposed to fit?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 sets of these socks for foot pain. I have wide size 8.5 feet, so I ordered the large/xl size. I could barely get these on my feet, and when I did, they were so tight, my circulation was impaired! I understand the concept of compression, but with a nursing background, I also know when there's too much compression. My 12-year-old couldn't even get them on his feet (equivalent to women's size 5)! So pretty much useless - and I can only return one pair. Unless you have baby feet, don't bother!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Shepard

customer_reviews.title: They actually would cause my heels to tingle because of what felt like lack of blood flow
customer_reviews.text: These did nothing whatsoever to help my plantar fasciitis. They felt tight around my foot, but didn't add any arch support whatsoever. They actually would cause my heels to tingle because of what felt like lack of blood flow. Total sales gimmick! I can't believe these got so many positive reviews. What I needed was actual arch support from an orthodic or insert. As another reviewer said, it's just an open-toed spandex sock. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh F.

customer_reviews.title: Cut Off My Circulation and Broke Down My Skin
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 7.5 shoe so I purchased a lg/xl and they were very tight on me and I don't have a very big foot so I don't know how someone with a much bigger foot can get these on. I do, however, have thick ankles and these socks cut off my circulation and the material started to break the skin down on my heel and this was while I was sleeping in them, not walking. I am going to try the compression sleeve next to to see if that works.
customer_reviews.author: nsomniak6

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9/10 so I ordered an XL. There is no way these could be worn by a female with size 12 feet. I've worn them to work twice and both times my feet hurt much worse than without. They do seem to be very well made but I wouldn't recommend them to anyone with a foot larger than maybe a 7 or 8 if they're narrow. I've never returned anything to Amazon. I'm not sure how that works so I'm just out $20.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle cure, but they do help.
customer_reviews.text: I've had plantar fasciitis for a couple of months and this was pretty much the last option before I just sawed my foot off. It took a few minutes to wrestle the sock on, but they do give some relief, more in the arches than the heel. I tried wearing one to work and had to take it off at lunch because they're just not comfortable to walk around in, but wearing them to bed does make it possible to go to the bathroom without crawling. I'm giving them two weeks to really make a difference, and then I may have to rethink the whole saw my foot off thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately it did nothing for my bottom of feet pains
customer_reviews.text: Been suffering from pains in bottom of my feet and soreness on top, while sitting in front of a computer all day. Do take some breaks and an under the table exercise equipment to try to keep blood circulated, but pains continue. Extreme pains when I stand during speaking engagements or readings at Church. Was hopefully this would help but unfortunately has done nothing for my pains :-( Returning and looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Thriving_Life

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Man! I was skeptical as to whether Physix plantar fascitis socks would help. But I put them on last weekend while I was at a conference where I had to be on my feet for large periods of time and wore them the entire day. The pain I felt in the ball of my right foot was excruciating at the start of the day, but by the end of the day, the pain was gone. I was walking normally. I generally only wear them at home, but I'm thinking that the greatest benefit of the socks comes when you wear them all day. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Herman Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Relief from Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Great socks as they provide true support and relief from planter fasciitis. I actually never really understood compression socks until I got plantar fasciitis and I can say these socks really, really, REALLY help. Without them I couldn't set my heel down! I wore them all day and night until I got better. First thing I would get for plantar fasciitis are these socks, and next is a plantar fasciitis shoe and insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great—But Hand Wash and Air Dry!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great! I’m a large woman with big feet, and my weight does a number on my feet, causing plantar fasciitis pain both in the morning and after being on my feet awhile (like during exercise). These little sleeves almost completely eliminate my plantar fasciitis pain, which makes exercise so much easier. They’re a little tough to put on because they squeeze so much, but after they’re on, they’re great! Almost like a regular sock, except they really do help with the pain! Unfortunately, mine shrank to the point of being uncomfortable after laundering them in my washer and dryer. Now I’m going to order another pair and hand wash and air dry them from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Fruit Batwoman

customer_reviews.title: Helps heal the pain in the heel
customer_reviews.text: I have had pain in the left foot for months now, topical creams and patches eased a bit however did not help especially if I had to stand or walk on it. Now This sock not only helps with the pain, I can walk on it now without much restrictions. I can wear it all day and hardly notice I am wearing it. This has been a great help in easing my heel pain and helps with the toes cramping also. The circulation is flowing again in my feet. I am very happy with this product and have purchased more.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without them.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these and a pair from another company. I just developed pain recently in my right foot and heel. I have not been diagnosed with any condition, but I have pretty awful pain. I decided I would order these because I was out of options to relieve my pain. These are comfortable and my pain is drastically less when I have them on. I have worn both pairs for a day at a time and these are far superior to the other brand I ordered. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: tara

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Fit.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Second pair that I bought and a waste of money. I wear a size 9 med shoe. These are supposed to fit Women 5-11. They are so tight I was afraid they would stop the circulation in my foot. I bought from two different companies but they look identical to each other and the problem existed with both. Will try to return these.
customer_reviews.author: tikitoo

customer_reviews.title: Finally heel pain relief after a long time!
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of excruciating heel pain, finally I found relief. The socks are very good quality, they have good supper and do not feel uncomfortable. I am really pleased that I chose these socks among so many different ones on Amazon. I wear them all day take them off at night, and when I wake up in the morning, I do not have pain when I take the first step like before. It has only been a week and I am much better.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fasciitis support socks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Plantar Fasciitis socks for my husband. I was concerned because he walks at least miles a day due to health reasons and we were leaving for vacation soon. Our trip involved a lot of walking. His foot was hurting. so much that he had to cut back on his walking. He tried everything. Rolling the frozen water bottle under his foot, pain relievers, ointments, and shoe inserts. Nothing was helping. I am please to say that these socks, while they did not alleviate all of the pain, they helped. We were able to hike in the mountains for short time limits without him being completely miserable. They did help.
customer_reviews.author: Texan Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: There is really good support in the ankle and part of the arch ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of suffering with plantar fasciitis I have tried everything from special shoes to socks, cortizone treatments and therapy. Y'all know how desperate you can get. These socks sorta work. I have a narrow foot so my ankles are smaller than the sock and the sock gives little support where your toes come out. There is really good support in the ankle and part of the arch area. These are more unisex design assuming that woman's foot is just smaller than a man's foot. There is no adjustment for narrow or wide feet.These maybe too tight for wide feet, I found them a bit tiring after 4-6 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Work great for all day comfort
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing! I’ve had them for two days and my feet are happy. I have nerve pain and possibly undiagnosed plantar fasciitis and these stop the pain as soon as I put them on. Unlike others I have tried, they go on fairly easily and have excellent compression. For reference I am small frame, 5’3, 118 lbs and purchased the Small/medium. They don’t cut off circulation at the ankle nor roll up on your foot where the opening is for your toes. I usually put these on as soon as I get up and take them off at bedtime. Occasionally, I will sleep with them if I haven’t worn them all day. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a 16 year old, my whole life. At 60, I have gotten plantar fasicit . From hike along river beds. Jumping boulders. This sock is great. Heel sinks into heel mold. Firmness is good. I love them. BUTT: I wore my first sock two times and the treads are breaking. I bought two more pairs. I just put second sock on and there is a run, running through the whole heel. Still feels good. I’ll wear them as long as they hold up. And maybe buy a few more pairs. These are $40.00 at my local Store.
customer_reviews.author: marcia freed

customer_reviews.title: considering my work shoes are not very comfortable. I took a chance and even walked a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and have been limping for quite some time now. I've worn these socks since I received them last week and have noticed a considerable difference. When I wear them to bed, I don't limp the minute I get up. I started wearing them to work and it has helped so much, considering my work shoes are not very comfortable. I took a chance and even walked a few flights of stairs, like I had normally done. It was easy, but I had a little pain after. Baby steps for now. I feel for the first time that my foot is on the mend!
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: Weird sizing and not for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a women's size 9-9.5 shoe and ordered the L/XL. When I tried to put them on, I could barely get them on my feet. Once they were in position, I thought my pinky toe was going to burst. I'm an athletic person and have normal/thin feet. Maybe they are kid's sizes? Anyway, I couldn't last five minutes in these, let alone hours. Had to return. Other than crazy sizing, they are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Raggie

customer_reviews.title: Great relief for plantar fasciitis pain and swelling!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Socks fit super tight, so I ordered a size up. There’s still plenty of support. Somehow, they lessen the pain caused by plantar fasciitis....which is a miracle. I’ve been trying to get in 4 miles a day of walking, and these really help. I’m hoping as I loose weight these will become less necessary, but if they help keep me exercising then mission accomplished. My only complaint is that they sometimes feel too tight when I’m on my feet for awhile, so I move the top of the sock down a little to redistribute the squeeze points. What I love most is when I first put them on, it feels like a foot massage!
customer_reviews.author: Courtenay Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Hate them
customer_reviews.text: These take the pressure pain off my heel but cause pain elsewhere, mostly all around my ankle. I can only wear for a couple hours before I have to take them off because of the pain they end up causing. They are really hard to put on too. I wear a size 7 shoe so I would think the S/M would be a fine fit. I'd be afraid the next size up would be too loose to provide adequate support. Oh well, not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Katydid

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is better for larger clients
customer_reviews.text: Bought these socks as I was quadrupling the amount of walking I would be doing every week. My feet were dying on my new job walking a 40,000 sq feet sales floor. I had tried another companies socks first, but they were so tight I would some times go home for lunch and remove them. Not so with these, feet are not dead at the end of the day, and the squeeze feels appropriate for what I need with these flat feet, my only regret is the other company had more colors to choose from, and if it would be possible to get a dress sock version
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nix

customer_reviews.title: Not Certain What The Big Deal Is
customer_reviews.text: First thing is I purchased the correct size so that was good news. As someone else mention these are EXTREMELY tight in my case feeling like blood circulation is being impeded. The other problem is it really pinches where your upper foot flexes when walking which is really uncomfortable. Have not noticed one positive bit of difference and they are too tight to put over the KT tape. I much prefer the tape so you can target the specific area using the appropriate tension for the issue. I will try just sleeping in them and see if anything helpful happens as long as my foot does not change color due to the excessive tightness.
customer_reviews.author: Mower of MuttsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 in women’s and it took me a good three minutes to get this completely in place on my foot. And it was then so tight, my foot began to throb. I bought the X/XL that should fit a women’s size 8-12. The whole time I was struggling to get it on, I thought to myself, if I going through full blown plantar fasciitis episode, the pain of getting it on would be unbearable. There’s no way a man wearing a size 10 could get this on his foot. I don’t understand why there are not more complaints about the inaccuracy of the size. Unless you have baby feet, buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: S DeTar

customer_reviews.title: The material is thin enough that I'm afraid they'll rip easily given the amount of tugging required to put them ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had similar sleeves before. I really don't think I'll order these again and might even re-order my previous brand and keep these as backups. I get that they're supposed to fit snugly, but they are incredibly difficult to put on. They don't seem overly snug/constricting once they are on--the fit seems appropriate to me, but getting them on is way harder than it ought to be, IMHO. The material is thin enough that I'm afraid they'll rip easily given the amount of tugging required to put them on. Also, they're incredibly long. I generally wear a women's size 7 or 7.5. These sleeves actually cover my toes except for my big toe and part of my second toe.
customer_reviews.author: Jenceco

customer_reviews.title: Plantar support socks
customer_reviews.text: Just love these, first few times putting them on was a bit challenging because they are tight but after a week they fit and feel great. I wear them at night instead of the big bulky boots for plantar relief. I can walk normally in the morning when i wear them at night, and during times that require standing for several hours they provide good support and seem to prevent pain. Glad i purchased, would definitely recommend buying these. If you have flexible spending, they are considered a eligible expense so this really made my purchase even better.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: These are basically compression socks. It's not going to do anything for plantar fasciitis. Don't waste your money. Buy one of those 2-3 inch rubber balls that you can roll your foot over. Use a frozen bottle of water for the pain - roll it back & forth under the arch of your foot for pain relief. Custom orthotic heel supports might help long term.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great socks from a company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: This company is fantastic! We ordered a pair of these socks and they work great and have really helped support the foot and keep the pain at bay. After about 3 days of wearing them, the right sock tore and it just so happened that I received an email from Physix inquiring about my order. I responded and mentioned the sock tearing...they were kind enough to promptly mail another pair to me and I couldn't be more satisfied with the sock and their service. I would recommend these socks to anyone with plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: KLA

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Helps relieve foot/heel pain.
customer_reviews.text: I walk regularly. I started have trouble with my feet, they began hurting so bad that I stopped walking. I read reviews on more than one type of compression socks. I decided to ordered two different name brands. I rotated them each day and discovered the Physixs were better quality. The other brand stretched out and did not hold their shape. I am so pleased with the relief the Physixs gear compression socks have given me. I am back to walking again! I have also ordered them for a family member who is struggling with foot pain and I have recommended them to others.
customer_reviews.author: k barron

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo goooood!!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from plantar fasciitis... I was on the border of shoe size 8-8.5 women, the large/xlarge was perfect! I work standing 12-15 hrs each day, and I’d wake up limping every morning from pain. These helped so much!! Within a few hours of having them on, I was able to get up without as much pain. I took them off for a couple hours to see if I felt the difference. Within 2 hours is taking them off, I felt the pain-limping again! I put them back on and yes, a few hours later, I was fine walking again. AMAZING PRODUCT! I’ll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: meeshie84

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent? Compression varies by color? Beige was fine, black does me no good
customer_reviews.text: Several months ago, I bought this product in "Beige L/XL" -- it fit well, provided excellent compression, and helped to alleviate my foot/ankle pain symptoms. Since I liked the product (and some other manufacturer's compression sleeves on Amazon are about as "compressive" as a tube sock), I ordered from Physix again but this time in "Black L/XL". Same size, different color -- but the compression is awful. There is MUCH less compression in the brand new Black pair even compared to my several-months-old and worn-out Beige pair. I'm disappointed that this second pair are basically useless to me, as they offer very little compression and do little to help with my foot pain symptoms.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY HELPED
customer_reviews.text: Really didn't think these would help. They definitely help. I could tell the difference the very first morning. Plantar Fascitis is a strange pain/problem/injury and doesn't consistently hurt in same spot or to same degree. These will not heal the injury by magic and should not be expected to do miracles. Anyone that gave these a bad review had idiotic expectations. I'm going on 4 months dealing with this and may be one of those that it takes a year to heal completely. These made a big turn for the better. Best $20 I've spent on Amazon so far.
customer_reviews.author: JW-INFIDEL

customer_reviews.title: Pain reliever without pills!
customer_reviews.text: I have Left Foot Freibergs Infraction; PF, Bone Spur, flat foot - foot basically feels like a humming drumming broke down factory 24/7 👀 Found these after review and decided to order. Nighttime is most painful for me, when I put them on they were tight but expected that. I felt relief - the compression seemed to work in the areas of main most needed. I kept them on til bed and next morning feet felt good, but rinse and repeat. I get the relief I need with the aching humming pain so I’ve ordered a few more pairs. Thanks! 😀
customer_reviews.author: gracie

customer_reviews.title: THEY DON'T FIT
customer_reviews.text: What I disliked was I purchased 2 pairs of 2XX socks and I have a size 12 Double Wide foot and they wouldn't even stretch out enough to go over my toes. I purchased a pair for my girl who has a size 8 foot her pair was the same thing. So I gave her a pair of my 12-15 XX socks, they wouldn't fit her foot either. So in closing, your one size fits all is no good. Make them to fit the sizes you say they will fit or keep them. Enjoy plenty of them being returned and a whole lot of people giving you really lousy referrals.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I am completely amazed at how my feet weren’t supported before having these! There is a HUGE difference in how my feet feel at the end of the day now. I’ve had extreme pain from plantar fasciitis for over a year. Orthotics have helped a little, but I haven’t been able to make any progress healing my feet. Now, with these compression socks, I am actually noticing improvements. I’ve worn these every day for about 6 weeks, and I’ve been mostly pain free for about 4 weeks. It’s amazing. If I had only gotten these a year ago...
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, lots of relief
customer_reviews.text: I wear this while walking, and sometimes around the house for support. It really helps my arches and overall foot support; however, it does not provide any type of heel pain relief. It may have even gotten worse—but, since it’s helped relieve my foot cramps, arch pain and ball-of-foot pain, it’s more likely that I just notice the heel pain more. I also ordered my fiancé a pair to see if they help him, and he has no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. The socks definitely help my heel... Surprisingly, I received an email from the company asking how I liked the socks. I responded that I love the socks but they were really tight on my foot - by my toes... I actually received a response explaining that I need to wear them for a couple of hours at a time to get my foot used to the sock... it is working. I was so impressed with the company reaching out to me without me initiating contact. The socks are great; the customer service is outstanding!!!! I would definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Borrajero

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support for my flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I have very flat feet and have sporadic foot problems since I taught aerobics for almost 20 years and now I walk every day. Recently I have had plantar fasciitis pain in one heel and ankle pain in the other foot. These compression socks have helped tremendously! They are extremely comfortable, light-weight and breathable. They give just the right amount of support and take up no additional room in my running shoes. I wash them by hand and they air dry very quickly. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia K

customer_reviews.title: 2 Pairs, One Better Than the Other
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs. One black pair, one nude pair. Both the same size. The nude pair offers better compression. I can feel the compression on my feet. The black pair are merely slightly snug socks. Not sure if it is intentional that the black pair offers less compression, but the other pair is great so far. I'm averaging out the score. 3 stars for the black pair offering little compression. 5 stars for the pair that are great at compression. If I order again, I'll avoid the black pair.
customer_reviews.author: D. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Very tight and difficult to get on.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the sleeves look and the price. I wear a size 7-7 1/2 shoe and ordered according to the size chart..S/M. The sleeves are incredibly tight and difficult to get on. In fact it caused a run in the heel when I put it on so I didn't try to get the other sleeve on. I wore the one for an hour or two. It was uncomfortably tight overall..and especially around my ankle. I think the sleeve could be helpful if they weren't so tight. Maybe the bigger size would have worked better for me. If you are considering buying them size up if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Smallest size isn’t small enough
customer_reviews.text: I’m a woman’s size 6 and the small is just a little bit too big for my feet. Because of this it covers my pinkie toe and squeezes it against my other toes which is uncomfortable and annoying. It doesn’t feel all that tight, but maybe that’s just because I’m used to wearing compression socks all the time.
customer_reviews.author: rae

customer_reviews.title: Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: I have a normal width foot, size 10. I ordered these for my husband however... went by their sizing chart.. and there was no way he could wear them. I was able to wear them however and found great relief and comfort from them. Because of this we will be ordering the larger size for my husband. So far, great product for me and I have an ankle that has been broken and tore up to the point where no one will do a surgical repair on... I would certainly give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: King Reader

customer_reviews.title: Instant Relief
customer_reviews.text: The Plantar Fasciitis Socks with Arch Support provided instant relief for me ... perhaps better than the podiatrist-supplied supports. While these socks are very useful, they do not provide a permanent cure for the problem. Even when wearing the sock I can over do it and be in pain. Nevertheless, they are very beneficial for pain management.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret buying these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for what I thought was plantar fasciitis. I did not get a diagnosis from a doctor, but I did enough research to be fairly certain that was my problem. I have high arches and at the end of the day I could barely walk. I wore these every day for about 2 months. I did purchase a pair of Vionic Satima athletic shoes at about the same time because I wanted to get away from the Skechers I had been wearing. I never thought this simple product would help me so much. I still have to be careful what shoes I wear but I don't have any foot pain most days. So thankful for them!
customer_reviews.author: D. Boos

customer_reviews.title: that products fits  and feels comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Having small, narrow feet I bought size small/medium. As it turns out, that size is too small and I would like to exchange them to a large/x-large via free return as advertised. Therefore, kindly email me a free return label as soon as possible. I definitely would like to use these compression sleeves. Thank you for your cooperation. A Runge
customer_reviews.author: A. Runge

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and suffer from foot pain all the time, especially when I stand or walk too long. I have tried arch supports and ugly shoes but finally got tendonitis is the tops of my feet and thought of trying something to support my whole foot. Wow, what a relief. Put them on immediately and pain was instantly better. Not too tight to wear all day and even over night. I have womens size 9 feet and got Large/Xlarge. I hate wearing something too tight. Bought two more pair immediately!
customer_reviews.author: minnymo

customer_reviews.title: Sizing seems to be off. Can’t wear them. Order up one size maybe they will fit you better.
customer_reviews.text: I went by the sizing chart, according to my shoe size. When they arrived and I tried it on it was so tight and hard to even get on! I actually tried to put them on upside down and they fit better, but still way too tight and I got the large/extra large . Hey my shoe size is an 8 1/2 -9.
customer_reviews.author: dge

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! Well made product..
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing...only 4 months with these compress socks and 2 have already ripped! Sorry must give you a 1 star for trying. 🥺 ............. I can't believe how good this product works! I've washed it about 3 times since I received it and it fits just the same as it was when new. Feels good, the pain has pretty much for me disappear. I highly recommend it to anyone with heel spurs/plantar's faciatis. *****5 stars all the way!!!! Thank you Physix Gear for helping walk with ease again.
customer_reviews.author: Luis M.

customer_reviews.title: Too long, crush toes inward
customer_reviews.text: Purchased using shoe size. Shoe size is about the length of the foot. These go past my small toe( little toe) Which causes it to end up being pressed underneath the next toe. Very painful. They did yield some support but due to the Crushing of the small toe underneath the next toe, I will most likely be unable to ever wear them. There is a brand called FS6, that works for my plantar fasciitis and does not cover my toe(s) I do recommend the FS6 brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nakitagirl

customer_reviews.title: This really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in order to help with PF pain. From the moment I put them on, I noticed a huge difference!! The first night I slept with it on, My expectation was low. I wasnt expecting to wake up and be able to walk without that annoying discomfort. But I was pleasantly surprised that I woke up without that discomfort!!!!! These socks are breathable, light weight and can be worn under regular socks and still be comfortable wearing with regular footwear. My discomfort has decreased drastically and I no longer have pain in the mornings. I am a distance runner and using this product in conjunction with the recommended rehabilitation/therapeutic exercises has helped tremendously in my recovery.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on my toes!
customer_reviews.text: Very tight on my toes and ankle. These are so tight my toes started to tingle after wearing for a short time. They feel great on my arches but if I can’t feel my toes and my ankles must be very fat because the band is so tight it leaves a mark. I wear 8.5 shoe. I guess these will hit the garbage with the other brands and I’ll keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Madona1950

customer_reviews.title: Helped me a lot.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for me. I found them easy to put on and take off. I wear an 11N shoe and the L/LX women's worked for me. Easy to wash. I have had plantar fasciitis in the past and felt that it was coming back. I wear them under my socks and have not issues during the day. Winter in Minnesota means that I am in snow boots a lot so I also put 3/4 length orthotics in my boots. Things are going great so far. Came back for 2 more pair to use while I wash the others.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: Real Relief like for real for real
customer_reviews.text: You know how you accept certain pain as part of life? I want to cry because I actually found something that relieves that pain. That rotted, infected pain that I WILL myself to ignore. I'm ordering another pair of bright, neon pink compression socks because I'm old, and my feet Hurt. Thank You to those amazing people who are responsible for my happy feet. Now I just need a compression headband for my tension headaches... Lets get to work people!
customer_reviews.author: camille slade

customer_reviews.title: Instant Relief for heel spur
customer_reviews.text: These immediately help my pain, and no drugs needed! Even when I am using orthotic inserts, these help. Sometimes I forget I have them if I haven't worn them in a few days and the pain returns. Then I remember, put them on, and it's instant relief! So glad I bought these. I am hoping the pain is eventually gone forever, but for now, these are great. I also like that I can paint my toe nails and wear these .... added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: ango

customer_reviews.title: They help!
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and am trying to lose weight. No small fete especially because my primary form of exercise is walking, and IT HURTS. I bought these sock and I can now do two miles on the treadmill. I'm not pain free by any means, however, I can at least tolerate the pain with these socks. I wear an 8.5 women's sneaker and I ordered the L/XL. That is the right size for me. I also ordered a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: vermontdreams

customer_reviews.title: Significant pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I had tried the copper compression arch support cuff and that product did not revise much relief at all. In comparison, I noticed a significant decrease in pain and discomfort after getting up from sitting at the desk with these socks. It does not feel too tight like the copper compression cuff, instead my arches feel supported. Wish I bought these first instead of wasting my money with the copper compression cuff. Also, I’m usually a 7.5/8 in shoes, bought the XL socks. They are a bit long so I just wore the socks upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Good but -
customer_reviews.text: My foot felt better from the moment I put it on - but it was waaay too tight. I tried sleeping with it and I woke up a few hours later and had to pull it off. My toes were numb and starting to tingle from the lack of circulation. I think they need to work on more accurate sizing. I wear a solid 7 1/2 ladies shoe and I bought the Small/Medium which fits 4- 71/5. I thought I was safe. The next size up was the large (8-12) and I was afraid that they would be too loose. Thinking back, I should have purchased the Large/Xlarge.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: can wear all day
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't completely gotten rid of my symptoms of heel spurs, but has made it bearable where I can at least walk. I wear them all day even under socks if Im going out. Otherwise just with slippers. And after a week of everyday wear I can miss a day here and there. I do not think these are a permanent solution, but for now I will use these until I have to make a more serious decision on my foot. Oh and only hand wash and hang dry. They kinda tighten up after getting wet and seem to need to be stretched alittle before wear.
customer_reviews.author: little kitty

customer_reviews.title: These really work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several different brands that don’t do much, but these felt different right away. I’ve been wearing these for over a week now, and they’ve helped immensely. I only wear one, on the affected foot, and it has made a huge difference. They give strong support without being too tight in the ankle. I also bought some Vionic shoe inserts and the combination of inserts and socks seems to be gradually fixing the problem.
customer_reviews.author: cl

customer_reviews.title: Much too small for US women's feet!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered US women's size 8-12 (L/XL) as indicated by their size chart, and they were so tight, they were actually painful. I only wear a size 8 shoe/sock, and I don't have wide or unusually shaped feet, so these should have fit perfectly, but they were at least 1 size too small.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Best foot compression sleeves ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best foot compression sleeves ever! Will be leaving on a month-long work vacation in Alaska and bought another pair. I worked as a cashier and was on my feet 9 hours a day and my left foot was causing me pain. I had developed plantar fasciitis and wear a night splint. I have tried many different insoles and none worked. Tried foot compression socks and arches, which worked better than insoles. Your foot sleeves are the best and I have thrown out all my previous brands. I wish I had discovered your sleeves last year. Thanks for a product that really works!
customer_reviews.author: Siss Ak

customer_reviews.title: very supportive
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate that this is a 2-pack. I only use one at a time for my plantar fasciitis and bone spurs, but having two allows me to have one to wear and one to wash. These are very snug and plenty long. I am a female with a size 8 (wide) foot and I ordered a L/XL. I do have to take it off after wearing it for 4 or so hours due to the tightness to give my foot "a break." I like the stability and support they provide when I'm on my feet. I would NOT recommend sizing down at all.
customer_reviews.author: akincl

customer_reviews.title: Feels  GOOD
customer_reviews.text: These feel SO good .My feet hurt so bad and i have yet to learn about how to take better care of my feet .I have a Dr. appointment .I do have bunionettes on both feet.Very high arches ,very wide feet ,and one size 8.5 and one size 7.5 foot.So its just wonderful all around. I was hesitant to buy this,but glad i did and for now only wear it under my sock in sneakers it does cut off your leg in an unflattering looking way and not hot and sexy ,yet it does not hurt where it cuts it off a bit. I really like this alot.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief indeed
customer_reviews.text: What I love is that these socks really give pain relief once you take them off. I wear them mainly at nights. But sometimes if my feet are acting up during the day I will wear. I wore them once to work and socks over but my socks can't coming down. What I don't like is the no slip band around the ankle, too tight. It drives me crazy. Even the toes part but I wiggle them around and up to help in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Locarno

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this product in hopes that I could stop wearing shoes with inserts around the house for my plantar fasciitis. I can for about 30 minutes longer than with no support, and then I need to get my shoes back on. I'm going to try it with my sandals this summer. I hope it works. It is tight and tricky to get on, but it needs to be tight to do it's job. The customer service of this company is AMAZING! I have been chatting with the owner through email. I will surely buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Chell

customer_reviews.title: Work well for me !
customer_reviews.text: Newly diagnosed with plantar fasciitis & desperate for some pain relief, I bought these. Very thankful I did. They’re tight but they have to be to work. I’m not saying that all the pain is gone but I can walk without agony. I’m on my feet for 8-13 hours at a time & literally would be hobbling after a few hours. With these, my mid-foot is supported & I hobble much less. Used with the orthotics prescribed by podiatrist for a much more comfortable shift.
customer_reviews.author: Paso Fino Lover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for comfort and pain while exercising
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because getting back into an exercise routine caused my right foot to have excruciating pain for several days after working out on the tredmill. These compression socks made a world of difference, and now due to wearing them while exercising, I have no pain. It is wonderful. I am super pleased with this product; great quality, and the price cannot be beat. I purchased three pairs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A Jam

customer_reviews.title: Has more
customer_reviews.text: I like the support on my heels and arches and they do have more compression than two other brands I have tried. My only complaint is that the foot portion is too long, it comes up over the 1st joint of my big toe , then completely covering my small toe and the 4 th toe. I have thought about possibly ordering a smaller size but I have a wide foot so I doubt that they would work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Iamshelmore

customer_reviews.title: Too tight
customer_reviews.text: These are really really tight. Like, hugs harder than grandma tight. If you wear them for a very short period of time, they feel good but it goes from good to omg I can't feel my toes rather quickly. For the love of God, do NOT fall asleep with them on. Maybe if you have small or narrow feet these work better?
customer_reviews.author: April S

customer_reviews.title: A friend of mine recommended these to me
customer_reviews.text: Hi. I usually tape my feet, when I have foot or knee pain. Have been wearing your socks to go on my 10,000 step daily routine. They seem to be working, with no need to tape. Am hoping when minor foot pain hits, that these will work for me. A friend of mine recommended these to me. They saved her on a trip to EU, so that she did not have to come home, because of a twisted ankle. Might be great prevention for travelers to take along.
customer_reviews.author: MK :-)

customer_reviews.title: Not so good for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality product in terms of material and construction. I'm a woman with a long (size 10-11) narrow foot. The socks were comfortable but did not offer enough snugness to create support and tension needed. I will probably wear them when hiking just as a bit of extra support but they aren't helping with pain and inflammation. Between the time I ordered and received, I found an inexpensive pair at Walmart. They are very snug and gave me some relief. The downside was the material tended to fold into the little skin folds around the front of ankle and that was irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support and good for other foot/leg pain. Size up if on upper edge of sizing.
customer_reviews.text: After spending a very cold winter wearing either pac boots or slippers with no arch support I began to suffer from lower leg pain and poor posture. I wear womens size 7 & 1/2 so I purchased the S/M. I have high arches and insteps and they felt tight but did give me some relief from the pain, however, I could not wear them all night. I ordered the L/XL and just got them. They feel fantastic and I think I can wear them while sleeping. I can also wear them with shoes. I do highly recommend these and will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: jkhiz

customer_reviews.title: Let your mind settle from that crazy image and now let me say that they fit snug (which feels pretty good) and they provide great support
customer_reviews.text: OK, disclaimer first. I am a grandma and upon getting these found them tight enough that I could not pull them on. Enter Grandpa who put my foot in his lap and laughed with me as he tried to get them on me and properly settled. Let your mind settle from that crazy image and now let me say that they fit snug (which feels pretty good) and they provide great support, which at my age is a good thing. But even if you are young, with today's flat, arch-less shoes, these could be a great addition to keep your arch supported and in tact. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SunnieA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, there are small holes in the seams on both sides on both socks. Read mostly good reviews for product. Also read the company’s description of how well product was made and the attention given to the details in making a quality product. This is definitely a quality control issue. Very disappointed and can not recommend. On the plus side, the support and compression works well and the socks are a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I have a severe flair up of PF that required some sort of compression to give me relief. My wife had foot surgery last year and I tried one of her expensive compression socks with the zipper. This worked well but was up over the calf. I researched Amazon and found this item. It looked sturdy and was what I was looking for. I am a 8.5 size men's shoe and ordered according to the chart. I have now worn these for 5 days and the fit and quality are very good. The compression is right where it should be and I would not hesitate to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good support. On the small side.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old daughter uses these for a condition she has called joint Hypermobility mobility syndrome. Her collagen doesn’t hold the bones of her feet together, so she has flat feet as a result. These support her feet and bring her arches up and decrease her pain. She wears a small/medium and it fits snugly on her size 3 child’s shoe sized foot. So be aware that these are small sized. They mean it when they say measure your foot before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sock Brace!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely appreciative of the previous reviews about this product, this is the reason I made my purchase. I was having a bad pain in my foot and my doctor told me I suffering from Planter Faciitis. I needed to buy a sole cushion on get a brace sock to help with the pain. I decided on the brace sock and now I can do the Happy Dance ☺️. So now I able to continue with my daily three mile run and my intense workouts. I am Happy Customer who will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs tight but long, making it awkward on the toes.
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is off, at least in my pair. I wear a woman’s size 8.5 so I ordered the recommended L/ XL sleeve. They fit tight but are too long, covering my toes. I was able to shift them to make comfortable and went to bed. I awoke in the middle of the night in god awful pain in my foot. The end by the toes had rolled up and was cutting off circulation. I tried again a second night but was so uncomfortable. I wonder if a smaller size would help, but I’m afraid to try.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Surprising solution to a very common problem.
customer_reviews.text: I like these more than I would've guessed. They are better quality than I would expect for the price. The compression is firm but not enough to cut off circulation. I finally feel like I have a chance to heal the inflammation in the tendon. Combined with stretching and deep tissue work I have noticed a tremendous decrease in pain. I wear these at night and no longer hobble around in the mornings. Hopefully I won't need these much longer, although I did order more. I wear a 7.5 in women's shoes and bought the small pair. Luckily these are very comfortable compared to night splints.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Trost

customer_reviews.title: You have to give it a few days
customer_reviews.text: So the first night that I used this I didn't notice much of a difference. HOWEVER! After the second night I was almost pain free and the third was completely pain free. I can now wake up in the morning and not hobble around for 5 minutes while everything warms up - tis amazing! I plan on wearing these while I read or lounge on the couch as that causes my foot to tighten up. I'm glad I tried these!
customer_reviews.author: M. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ankle compression but “busy” look.
customer_reviews.text: These socks r life savers. They handle my minor ankle swelling (Achilles tendon pain) comfortably, no pinching, no overheating. I don’t need knee length. Toeless anklets mean much less pain, better circulation and easy on/off. I WISH they would get rid of the writing all around the top bc it shows and looks awful with office pants, etc. - the office is where these socks r so greatly needed. Great buy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. McElwrath

customer_reviews.title: Highest recommendation for both product and seller!
customer_reviews.text: I sent these socks to my step-daughter who has Plantar Fasciitis. She said they arrived quickly and that they work just great to relieve her foot pain. She loves them. The seller, Adam, is just awesome. He has emailed me a couple of times to make sure my order arrived in a timely fashion and that all was well. The customer service for Physix Gear Sport is beyond compare. They have lots of other cool stuff besides these socks, so go check them out. Very highly recommend both product and seller!
customer_reviews.author: Mumsie

customer_reviews.title: Good bye- Foot/arch discomfort.
customer_reviews.text: Received them, put one on my right foot, instant relief from the discomfort of Plantar fasciitis . As a person that walks barefooted (I should not ) these great socks allow me to walk around the house, without any discomfort and or pain. They were well with shoes and slippers. good fit and able to stretch over foot well. Great amazon deal. Seller is available for any problems with the item. Great compression without cutting off circulation
customer_reviews.author: John A. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: ***Pay Attention!***
customer_reviews.text: If your shoe size is at the high end of the ranges listed in their chart, I recommend going UP a size. For example, I am a ladies size 10 shoe. According to their chart I should buy the extra large. It was dreadful. It’s strangled me in every possible way it could. Then I bought the next size up and it was a firm tight supportive fit. And I love it. Would give five stars except for this glitch.
customer_reviews.author: luvobx

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t really have high hopes so I wasn’t surprised that these did nothing for my PF. No decrease in pain at all. They just felt like slightly tight socks. Not sure how that’s supposed to support anything. I hope they work for others but for me, they did not. I’m an average sized woman with skinny feet and ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Finally, some relief!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these!! I'm on my feet all day and even have specially designed plantar fasciitis relief shoes, which help, but once the shoes come off, the pain is sometimes unbearable. These socks help alleviate quite a bit of that pain, and make it much easier to walk.
customer_reviews.author: kellik

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, not a miracle worker by any means
customer_reviews.text: It's a compression sock, I am not seeing a big difference in pain relief. I have a horrible bone spur caused by plantar fasciitis.. I wear them when I'm walking or exercising and I can say I see maybe a 10% improvement, if I dont wear them. Helps a little with pain in the morning , that's if I can get passed my foot sweating all night from the sock itself. I usually end up taking it off in the middle of the night
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pain be gone!
customer_reviews.text: Felt relief after a few minutes of wearing. I now wear it during the day. Did try wearing at night but I kept waking up with toe pain. I tried pulling them up so it wasn't on the toes but it would move back. So now I wear them during the day and off at night. Love the product. Has made my life easier. Walking is so much better without that horrible pain. You've done a great service. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to wear through the night
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size based upon my shoe size. They are very very tight. Which is good for support and I do believe that overall they assist in keeping the foot in a neutral position to allow the plantar fasciitis to heal some over night. But my gosh they hurt after wearing a few hours. Sometimes it's the top of my foot and sometimes it's the side of my foot but I rarely got through a night that I didn't yank them off sometimes before morning.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Mason Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great support!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife who has been suffering from PF in her left foot. Based on the reviews, she went with this for help. It has been giving her great support and better relief from the pf...although after a few hours, she does need to take it off because it is very tight around her lower calf (that's why we gave 4 * instead of 5*). I did notice that someone reviewed stretching the socks out on their arms prior to wearing...think we will give this a try. Nice product that arrived in a timely manner. Thanks for the pain relief!
customer_reviews.author: William O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must have for anything FEET.
customer_reviews.text: My sister-inlaw recommended these, she's a nurse and wears them for every shift to reduce swelling. So I got them for my 12 year old who plays a lot of soccer. She wears these under her soccer socks and they eliminate blisters and keep her feet from getting tired during long tournament weekends. In fact, she likes them so much she sometimes wears them with her flip flops. She says, "mom, my feet feel amazing!"
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very Supportive For Standing But The Arch Support Slips Around When You Walk
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate relationship with these socks. I bought them for the arch supporter to help relieve my plantar pain after long hours on the trails. They are definitely supportive BUT the arch support slips to the side when I walk more than a couple of steps. So they are great for standing, which is important if you have plantar pain, but not so much if you have to move around at all. Maybe I should crazy glue them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Random Blogger

customer_reviews.title: These Socks Work!
customer_reviews.text: These are great socks, very well made and they work! My feet didn’t get hot even after hours of wear, the fabric is superior to other such socks I’ve tried in the past. The socks offered great support for my high arches and worked to calm my plantar fasciitis. They washed up well and I appreciated the detailed wash recommendations from the vendor. I love it when a product lives up to the description, this one actually exceeded my expectations. The support from the seller was amazing too,very good follow up and customer centered.
customer_reviews.author: JD

product_meta.title: Plantar Fasciitis Socks with Arch Support for Men & Women - Best 24/7 Compression Socks Foot Sleeve for Aching Feet & Heel Pain Relief - Washes Well, Holds Shape & Better Than a Night Splint
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :5.91 x 0.79 x 3.94 inches; 2.4 Ounces
 * Item model number :ttt8666
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :December 28, 2015
 * Manufacturer :Physix Gear Sport
 * ASIN :B019WOPQC6

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #480 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #3 inPlantar Fasciitis Braces & Supports 
    *  #1 inVolleyball Ankle Guards 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.3 out of 5 stars15,077 ratings
feature_bullets: FAST RELIEF for painful Plantar Fasciitis. Get instant arch support stopping awful heel pain & throbbing, helping you stand and walk freely again. Feel the Joy with a Targeted Compression and Ankle Support in the ankle Splint area without restricting motion. The ankle support features graduated compression to support the ankle. The compression in the ankle to heel support also improves achilles tendonitis & circulation reducing inflammation & expediting the planter fasciitis healing process.

#1 RECOMMENDED DESIGN from top selling Physix Gear Sport, preferred by trainers everywhere. Perfect for anyone suffering from Planter Fasciitis & Ankle Spurs Pain. The foot & ankle brace sock features gradual compression on the bottom of the sleeve, helping relieve planter fasciitis pain, compressing the plantar fascia ligament. A thin design allows your sleeve to be worn all day or night helping relieve chronic foot pain, Edema Treatment & Heel Spurs Boosting Blood circulation & recovery

VERY COMFORTABLE - Designed with 80% Nylon & 20% Spandex, Feel secure with a sleeve that holds your foot at the correct angle with just the right level of healing compression. Wear with sandals, shoes, boots, insoles, slippers, & under any socks. Breathable Moisture Wicking Ankle Spur Arch Support Sleeves are made of the Best innovative lightweight breathable & durable fabrics Staying dry even during the toughest workouts, running, hiking, jogging, or just walking indoors. Quality On your Feet!

WALK WORK IN COMFORT - Your New Foot Sleeves gives all day relief limiting Planter Fasciitis foot and heel aches. The ankle support features oedema level compression within the sleeve, relieving achilles tendonitis & splint pain by compressing the planter fascia ligament. The Thin design allows all day or night wear, helping relieve fasciitis. Whether wearing Kinesiology Tape, Inserts, splint supports, orthotics, or Orthopedic shoes, enjoy a comfortable thin Sleeve no matter the conditions.

GET READY. TO BECOME A RAVING FAN! – We cut no corner in our product and will cut no corners in our support of you! You are making a very intelligent decision doing business with our company. We know you're a big deal and we'll only provide you with the finest product and service around or your MONEY BACK! Add your Physix Gear Sport Planter Fasciitis Socks to your Cart and experience the Physix Gear customer experience phenomenon! Add to cart now to begin the amazing journey!
